intro: Rostellularia adscendens var. pogonanthera, commonly known as the purple-stemmed rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. The variety pogonanthera is distinguished by its distinctive purple stems and showy inflorescences.
